Article.Abstract: Sin Nombre virus (SNV) causes hantavirus pulmonary syndrome (HPS), with a high rate of mortality in humans who are infected by the transmission of virus from the natural rodent host. In humans, cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTL) specific for SNV appear to play an important role in the pathogenicity of HPS. There is a correlation between the frequencies of SNV-specific CTLs and the severity of HPS disease. In order to create a mouse model to study the role of SNV-specific T cells in vivo, T cell responses to SNV nucleocapsid (N) protein in B6.PL Thy1(a)/Cy mice (H-2(b)) immunized with plasmid DNA or recombinant vaccinia virus expressing SNV N protein were examined. Four peptides, NC94-101, NC175-189, NC217-231 and NC331-345, were recognized by CD8(+) T cells in CTL and ELISPOT assays in SNV N-immunized mice. Interestingly, two of these epitopes are located in the central region of the SNV N protein, where several human CD8(+) T-cell epitopes have been defined in Puumala virus and SNV. CTL lines specific for these four epitopes were cross-reactive to corresponding Puumala virus peptides, but only one of them was cross-reactive to Hantaan virus peptides. These results will enable the analysis of the roles of CTL in immunopathology of HPS in experimental mouse models of HPS.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification and analysis for cross-reactivity among hantaviruses of H-2b-restricted cytotoxic T-lymphocyte epitopes in Sin Nombre virus nucleocapsid protein.
Article.Affiliations: Center for Infectious Disease and Vaccine Research, University of Massachusetts Medical School, 55 Lake Avenue North, Worcester, MA 01655, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Epitopes;H-2 Antigens;Histocompatibility Antigen H-2D;Isoantigens;Nucleocapsid Proteins;Peptide Fragments
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antibody Specificity; Cell Line, Tumor; Cross Reactions; Epitopes(immunology); H-2 Antigens(immunology); Hantavirus(immunology); Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome(immunology); Histocompatibility Antigen H-2D; Humans; Isoantigens(immunology); Major Histocompatibility Complex(immunology); Mice; Molecular Sequence Data; Nucleocapsid(immunology); Nucleocapsid Proteins(genetics; immunology); Peptide Fragments(immunology); Sin Nombre virus(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of 2 X 10^7 PFU of recombinant vaccinia, administered 4 weeks apart.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A separate group of mice were immunized with a DNA plasmid encoding the nucleocapsid protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Cells from mice immunized with a DNA plasmid encoding the nucleocapsid protein were negative.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg DNA, administered at weeks 0, 2 and 4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: An epitope-specific CTL line was generated.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific CTL line reacted with the peptide fragment containing the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg DNA, administered at weeks 0, 2 and 4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: An epitope-specific CTL line was generated.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific CTL line cross-reacted with the antigen peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg DNA, administered at weeks 0, 2 and 4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A separate group of mice were immunized with recombinant vaccinia virus expressing the SNV nucleocapsid protein. An epitope-specific CTL line was also created.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Cells from mice immunized with recombinant vaccinia virus expressing the SNV nucleocapsid protein were also positive. An epitope-specific CTL line was also positive.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg DNA, administered at weeks 0, 2 and 4.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice were restimulated in vitro with a peptide pool containing the epitope. Short-term restimulated splenocytes and epitope-specific CTL lines were tested. A separate group of C57BL/6J mice were immunized with a recombinant vaccinia virus expressing SNV nucleocapsid protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Short-term restimulated splenocytes and epitope-specific CTL lines were all positive. Cells from nucleocapsid protein DNA-immunized B6.PL Thy1a/Cy and recombinant vaccinia virus-immunized C57BL/6J mice produced the same results.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 2 doses of 2 X 10^7 PFU of recombinant vaccinia, administered 4 weeks apart.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were tested with or without in vitro stimulation with the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Ex vivo splenocytes and in vitro restimulated splenocytes showed the same response.
